alert.note: Alert for Brown; McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 5:23AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Brown, eastern McCulloch and northwestern San Saba Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 523 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rochelle, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brady, Richland Springs, Algerita, Elm Grove, Winchell, Zephyr, Lohn, Rochelle, Skeeterville, Placid, Mercury, Hall, Locker, Harkeyville, Milburn, Spring Creek, Us-190 Near The Mcculloch- San Saba County Line and Indian Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for west central Texas.
